description: The function 'draw_lines_rays_and_segments' generates a 2D plot of points, lines, rays, and segments based on the input data. It is designed to help students visualize and understand the basic concepts of geometry, particularly the differences between lines, rays, and segments.

educational_standards.description: Identify points, lines, line segments, rays, right angles, obtuse angles, acute angles, parallel lines, and perpendicular lines in two-dimensional figures.
Classify triangles as right, acute, or obtuse.
Recognize, name, and use the properties of lines, rays, and angles to analyze and solve geometric problems.

stimulus_type_specification.title: Available Images: Lines, Rays, and Segments Visualization
stimulus_type_specification.description: The function can draw points, lines, rays, and segments on a 2D plane. It accepts input data in the form of a list of points (with labels and coordinates) and a list of lines (with start and end labels, and type). The type of line can be 'line', 'ray', or 'segment'. The function validates the input data to ensure that the labels and coordinates are valid and that the line type is recognized. This visualization can be used in geometry lessons to help students understand and differentiate between lines, rays, and segments.

details: Points: A list of points, each with a label and coordinates
Lines: A list of lines, each with start and end labels, and a type ('line', 'ray', or 'segment')
The labels in the lines should correspond to the labels of the points
The coordinates should be valid numbers
The labels should be unique for each point
The line type should be either 'line', 'ray', or 'segment'
The start and end labels of a line should correspond to the labels of the points
The function draws points as dots on a 2D plane
Lines, rays, and segments are drawn between the points based on the input data
Lines are drawn as arrows extending in both directions, rays as arrows extending in one direction, and segments as lines with no arrows
The points and lines are labeled for easy identification
